document.heading: Mental Health Service Delivery Reform Act of 2001

history.narrative: Law 14-56, the “Mental Health Service Delivery Reform Act of 2001”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-136, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 26, 2001, and July 10, 2001, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 24, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 14-119 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-56 became effective on December 18, 2001.
